Jo Bennett

Well, a huge proportion of the world's phones are made by Nokia, and a fair proportion of my furniture and kitchen utensils are made by Ikea. So, since you ask, probably the large mixing bowl I use for making bread, a plastic spatula and a pair of kitchen scissors. Considering the US is 30+ times the size of either country, I doubt I've bought 30 times as much stuff from US companies. The only reason it's even close is because of US media products and a (semi) shared language.
 
 In any case, it's largely irrelevant when you consider the standard of living in Scandinavia, and the high GDP per capita. It doesn't matter if you have household names based there when people have enough to live on and can afford healthcare, childcare and education.
Penfold

Sweden's exports are healthy enough that the US had a nine and a half billion dollar trade deficit in 2006. Volvo or Saab ring any automotive bells? And the world's biggest paper producing company is Finnish. (along with the third biggest.) They also have the shipyards that built the worlds largest cruise ships such as the "Freedom of the Seas", Kone who make elevators and escalators.....
 Tiny "socialist" nations who do pretty well for themselves...

Sorry, I'm just going to repost something I posted in another thread:
 
What an idiotic statement! Obama is not a socialist, he is not going to tax the rich and then go over and redistribute that money to the poor. The rich are, finally, going to have to pay their way for the services they have gotten either for free or at very low cost from our tax-financed services at all levels, police protection, the protection of the courts, roads, bridges, infrastructure, etc., and the increased money will also, I hope, be used to lower the debt that Bush incurred in order to lower taxes on the rich.
 
 Obama also wants to create American jobs instead of outsourcing them overseas. Outsourcing was done by the Bush administration in order that the very rich could have access to slave labor in China and elsewhere. Unfortunately, they were stupid and didn't realize that jobless Americans would be unable to pay off their mortgages and buy goods.
 
 Obama wants to see working people paid a living wage so that they can afford to buy, to consume American goods, so they can afford to pay off their mortgages, send their kids to college, do all the things that are part of the American dream that Bush has so carefully dismantled.
 
 Obama wants our nation to become America, the land of opportunity for all, again.
 
 Only anti-Americans would have a problem with that.
